channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Don't get angry, but the 2025 Oxford Word of the Year is 'rage bait'
item.description: The 2025 selection follows its predecessors, "brain rot" from 2024, "rizz" from 2023 and "goblin mode" from 2022.
item.content:encoded: The 2025 selection follows its predecessors, "brain rot" from 2024, "rizz" from 2023 and "goblin mode" from 2022.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: This man serenades tourists in a Boston park with a taste of their homeland
item.description: We meet a man who serenades tourists in a national park in Massachusetts with songs of their homeland in their native language. And he's got a song for almost any nation.
item.content:encoded: We meet a man who serenades tourists in a national park in Massachusetts with songs of their homeland in their native language. And he's got a song for almost any nation.
item.dc:creator: Craig LeMoult

item.title: Student Podcast: Fry bread's complicated place in Native culture
item.description: Fry bread is a popular food in many Native communities — but has a dark history. One student talks to her grandmother about its complicated place in Native culture.
item.content:encoded: Fry bread is a popular food in many Native communities — but has a dark history. One student talks to her grandmother about its complicated place in Native culture.
item.dc:creator: Student Podcast Challenge

item.title: 'I'm telling a silent story': Paul Tazewell on 'Wicked' and the magic of costume design
item.description: The Oscar-winning costume designer has been enchanted by Oz and Munchkinland for most of his life. He created more than 1,000 looks for Wicked: For Good — including Elphaba's "sex cardigan."
item.content:encoded:
The Oscar-winning costume designer has been enchanted by Oz and Munchkinland for most of his life. He created more than 1,000 looks for Wicked: For Good — including Elphaba's "sex cardigan."

(Image credit: Lara Cornell/Giles Keyte)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: From subways to galleries: Miami's Museum of Graffiti traces the appeal of street art
item.description: A new show at Miami's Museum of Graffiti traces the origins and development of street art. What began in the 1970s with teenagers tagging New York subway cars has grown into a worldwide art movement.
item.content:encoded:
A new show at Miami's Museum of Graffiti traces the origins and development of street art. What began in the 1970s with teenagers tagging New York subway cars has grown into a worldwide art movement.

(Image credit: Greg Allen)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Your 2025 holiday movie guide: Time travel, pickleball and fa-la-la-la franchises
item.description: We're taking stock of this year's notable holiday movies, with titles including such gems as Oy to the World!, Christmas at the Catnip Cafe, A Merry Little Ex-Mas, and A Pickleball Christmas.
item.content:encoded:
We're taking stock of this year's notable holiday movies, with titles including such gems as Oy to the World!, Christmas at the Catnip Cafe, A Merry Little Ex-Mas, and A Pickleball Christmas.

(Image credit: Amanda Matlovich)
item.dc:creator: Linda Holmes

item.title: Sunday Puzzle: Dog breeds
item.description: NPR's Lauren Frayer plays the puzzle with Kevin Demko of Rehoboth Beach, Delaware and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Lauren Frayer plays the puzzle with Kevin Demko of Rehoboth Beach, Delaware and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

item.title: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88
item.description: Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.
item.content:encoded:
Arcadia, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead and The Coast of Utopia. He's pictured above in London in 2017.'/>

Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.

(Image credit: Justin Tallis/WPA Pool)
item.dc:creator: Tom Vitale

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for November 29, 2025: With Not My Job guests Paul Giamatti, Laufey, and more!
item.description: On this week's show, we replay some of the segments we're most thankful for, including interviews with Paul Giamatti, Laufey, Ibtihaj Muhammad, and James Gunn!
item.content:encoded:
On this week's show, we replay some of the segments we're most thankful for, including interviews with Paul Giamatti, Laufey, Ibtihaj Muhammad, and James Gunn!

(Image credit: Presley Ann)

item.title: Why a revival of the 1998 musical 'Ragtime' resonates with audiences today
item.description: With its mix of Jewish immigrants, Black residents of Harlem, and privileged white characters, the Broadway show Ragtime is resonating strongly with audiences in the current political climate.
item.content:encoded: With its mix of Jewish immigrants, Black residents of Harlem, and privileged white characters, the Broadway show Ragtime is resonating strongly with audiences in the current political climate.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Lunden
